correction_response: This tweet is partially misinformed. While it's true that there were multiple shootings in Uvalde, Texas, the most recent incident at the memorial park was suspected to be gang-related, not directly linked to the loosening of Texas's gun laws [https://abcnews.go.com/US/uvalde-police-investigating-shooting-injured-victims-memorial-park/story?id=89560553]. Governor Abbott has indeed been involved in passing laws that bolster gun rights, but he has also taken action to address the issue of gun violence, such as dispatching additional state trooper units to Uvalde and coordinating anti-gang efforts [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2022/09/08/uvalde-shooting-memorial-park-police-say-injured-victims-found/8028485001/]. It's important to consider the complexity of the issue and the multiple factors contributing to these tragic events.
note_1_text: This shooting occurred in Memorial Park, not at a memorial for the Uvalde school shooting victims. An altercation in the park between a group of young people resulted in two teens being injured by gunfire.   https://amp.www.complex.com/life/shooting-reported-uvalde-texas-memorial-park
note_2_text: It was not a memorial for the victims of the Uvalde shooting. It was Uvalde Memorial Park (just as many parks throughout the nation are named "Memorial Park" with the name of the community in front of it).     https://www.cnn.com/2022/09/08/us/uvalde-shooting-memorial-park/index.html
